title: home page
desciption: Design pattern for FE developer use (Nunjucks, Sass, Vue and Javascript)

product_list.title: Gulp
product_list.short_desc: A toolkit to automate & enhance your workflow
product_list.desc: Leverage gulp and the flexibility of JavaScript to automate slow, repetitive workflows and compose them into efficient build pipelines.

product_list.title: Nunjuck
product_list.short_desc: Nunjucks is a full featured templating engine for javascript
product_list.desc: Nunjucks has allowed us to port all of our existing templates from a Django project to something that's easier to manage. By moving our templates to the client, transfer sizes are reduced and page responsiveness increases significantly. Our API supplies data, meaning we can decouple testing the front-end from testing the back-end. Nunjucks has made our app feel native.

product_list.title: Sass
product_list.short_desc: Sass is the most mature, stable, and powerful professional grade CSS extension language in the world.
product_list.desc: Sass is an extension of CSS, adding nested rules, variables, mixins, selector inheritance, and more. It's translated to well-formatted, standard CSS using the command line tool or a plugin for your build system.

product_list.title: Javascript
product_list.short_desc: JavaScript (JS) is a lightweight, interpreted, or just-in-time compiled programming language with first-class functions
product_list.desc: JavaScript is among the most powerful and flexible programming languages of the web. It powers the dynamic behavior on most websites, including this one.

product_list.title: VueJS
product_list.short_desc: Vue.js is an MIT-licensed open source project
product_list.desc: Vue.js is an MIT-licensed open source project with its ongoing development made possible entirely by the support of these awesome backers.
